questions.prompt:
Read the passage carefully and answer the questions that follow.

**THE NEW STUDENT**

Sarah Chen clutched her bag tightly as she walked through the school gates on her first day at Westwood Secondary. The unfamiliar surroundings made her heart pound with anxiety. Back in her old school, she had been popular and confident, but here, she felt like a small fish in a vast ocean.

The morning assembly was overwhelming. Hundreds of students filled the hall, their voices creating a deafening buzz. Sarah spotted an empty seat near the back and quickly slipped into it, hoping to remain invisible.

"Hey, you're the new student, right?" A cheerful voice startled her. Sarah turned to see a girl with bright eyes and a friendly smile. "I'm Maya. Don't worry, everyone feels lost on their first day. I remember being terrified when I started here last year."

Sarah felt a wave of relief wash over her. "I'm Sarah. Is it really that obvious that I'm new?"

Maya laughed. "Well, you have that 'deer in headlights' look that all new students have. But trust me, by next week, you'll feel right at home." She paused and then added, "Why don't you sit with me and my friends during recess? We can show you around the school."

As the day progressed, Sarah discovered that Westwood Secondary was not as intimidating as she had imagined. The teachers were welcoming, and several classmates made efforts to include her in conversations. During recess, Maya introduced her to a group of friendly students who bombarded her with questions about her previous school and hobbies.

By the end of the day, Sarah realized that her initial fears had been unfounded. She had made her first friends and was beginning to appreciate the unique opportunities that her new school offered. As she walked home, a smile played on her lips. Perhaps this new chapter in her life would turn out to be an exciting adventure after all.
